website_summaries.verdict: A very economical alternative to industrial-grade engravers, and includes three templates, not just the standard letter and number plate.
pros: Multi-functional tool can both carve and engrave most materials
Letter, number, and shape templates included
cons: Bulky and difficult to control while engraving

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far! Super easy to set up and use. I would say the lower settings are better for glass and the higher better for metal. Thinking about trying to get more tips to see if I can shade in things but it seems like it is only really good for thinner lines and not large swatches of metal. I printed out a stencil and did this on a flask.
customer_reviews.author: margie friedman

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used this to etch both metal and wood. I’m very happy with the results. The Machine itself is very loud. I’d recommend using some sort of ear protection if you have a larger project, just for your own comfort. Also, plan on wearing some sort of eye protection. I believe I read that in the instructions. Better safe than sorry, fine metal shavings will be flying. I’d recommend writing what you want to etch in pencil first so you can concentrate on the edge and depth of your etched line. Overall, I’m extremely happy with my purchase. The price was fair. It seems to be a quality machine. Had no issues what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Very good engraver.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work really well but lousy instructions on how to insert the bits. It's not a flat head screwdriver it's an allen wrench that needs to be inserted into the hole on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Denise   MA

customer_reviews.title: Nice !
customer_reviews.text: does what it's supposed to do. i was initially worried about the vibration... but it isn't to bad . kit comes with everything pictured: allan wrench, 4 engraving tips and 2 plastic cutouts. this takes a while to get used to if your using the tracing templates... but i found it was easier to just freehand letters and things that i wanted to engrave.hopefully it holds up... it feels good in the hand and feels well enough made. no complaints thus far... BUT I WILL CHANGE MY REVIEW IF ANYTHING HAPPENS
customer_reviews.author: SPK SR.

customer_reviews.title: Sickened how bad it is.
customer_reviews.text: The need ear protection is an understatement. Extremely loud and even one set on 1 vibrates so hard it shattered the glass piece I was working on. The drill bits are horrifically bad quality. It comes with 4 bits and I went through all four while, making a 4x4 mirror piece. The bits were worn down so fast that I barely was able to complete a very small and simple project. To make it worse to buy more drill bits is too expensive. Not worth the price and is a waste of space.
customer_reviews.author: Willow Redblood

customer_reviews.title: Has been able to take everything I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.text: I've etched a lot of stuff with this, even perhaps 50 pieces of stainless steel, and the tip is still razor sharp. Beyond what was expected, and bordering on the downright impressive. The device fit and finish could be better, but it functions well just the same. For instance, the sticker has fallen off, but who really cares? The only downside is its quite loud, but then, they all are. It's how they work. Bang on a sheet of metal 40,000 times a second and see what happens, right? Get some good earmuffs and go to town!
customer_reviews.author: L. Eilander

customer_reviews.title: Engraver for DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Interesting little tool for carving letters and shapes. It came with A-Z and shapes templates. Great for my use case, which is to do a little "No Soliciting" sign, which is around $10+ for a quality metal one on amazon. If I can make two, this tool basically pays for itself :) It came with a few replaceable carbon tips and I like the hook design for hanging on peg board. I do have one complaint about its ergonomic design - the on/off switch seems to be in an awkward position and won't allow quick easy access. I suggest the manufacture improve the usability in the next iteration.
customer_reviews.author: Tools. Electro. DIY

customer_reviews.title: It completely died in under 20 minutes of use.  F- product.
customer_reviews.text: This engraver, the Taclife EGD12AC died - completely - with less than 20 minutes of use. When it worked, it was doing a decent job of engraving. However, now - even with the absolute slightest amount of pressure when engraving, it just stops. The motor keeps going, but it won't engrave. I'm not a novice at this - there is a defect with this product where it can't sustain any pressure for any decent length of time without burning out. I can not, in any measure of good faith, recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Too violent for fine work
customer_reviews.text: The action is way too violent for fine work. The tips are junk. The plastic stencils are useless. Too cheap to return. I will preform a levitation test over the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Laidig

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this one but what a disappointment: absolutely TERRIBLE at engraving. I tried several different items to engrave - plastic, wood, and glass - and it BARELY made an impression, no matter the setting. I also expected some noise but this was also surprisingly LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Abramson

customer_reviews.title: Did not carve worth a darn. Very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Returned it right away. Did not carve worth a darn. Very cheap Just wanted to engrave initials on the bottom of a cup and it couldn't even do that
customer_reviews.author: T Wag

customer_reviews.title: Great price works well would order again
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured and described would order from this seller again the tool seems to work properly I’ve not done much I did put a hole in a shell it did that easily I can’t control it well enough for engraving to look nice may have to try smaller tool for that it is what I ordered and works
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN
customer_reviews.text: It was broken. The directions were wrong. They said to use a flat head when it's an Allen wrench. The top part of the plastic broke off and the plastic part around the tip was splitting down the middle.
customer_reviews.author: shianna freeman

customer_reviews.title: this was super easy to use and I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has only dabbled in crafts and machinery a little bit, this was super easy to use and I absolutely love it! I have already engraved a compass and a telescope that I bought off of Amazon as gifts. It is easy to handle, like a very large pencil, and after trying a few things on a piece of sheet metal I had my own handwriting pretty much down. It is very loud so and very shaky, so you may not want to get this if you have sensitive hands or are not very strong, but it's a wonderful tool for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: it worked great!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tool to mark all of mine construction tools..... It worked perfectly. Also, I marked my sons hot wheels and my daughters baby( upon their request); it worked great!!!!! It is not to loud and the thickness of the tip is just right; the engravement looks clean a d professional.
customer_reviews.author: John Woo

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Good Engraver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this engraver when the tip kept falling out of the last one I had. The tip on this stays in place and engraves well. I still shake a lot due to the nature of it, but is well shaped and not cumbersome to guide in my hand. I only engrave to identify things and not for artistic reasons. Overall I am happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Tallgirl

customer_reviews.title: I've engraved about 500 tools so far, with some ...
customer_reviews.text: I've engraved about 500 tools so far, with some of that being constant use. Aside from my hand vibrating hours later, it held up to and hour of constant use with no overheating or any issues.
customer_reviews.author: turbojohn86

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I use for two time for 5 minutes job then machine stop working !! Getting heat without using after one day its working for 20 second and stop
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Good for identifying school supplies
customer_reviews.text: Love it to engrave my kids names on all their school stuff. Even sharpies eventually rub off, this tool engraved deep enough to be seen but not wreck the product. I've also used it on other household things that sometimes get mixed up like tv remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Christy P.

customer_reviews.title: The included instructions do not match my model. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The included instructions do not match my model. I can't insert bit due to too much paint in the dial. I can't find a phone number to call their customer service. Made in China .....not uncommon I know but surely a U.S. manufacturing rep? I am sending it back today.
customer_reviews.author: cindyrose

customer_reviews.title: Loud, powerful.  Not exactly entry-level.
customer_reviews.text: This engraver is super LOUD. I bought it thinking that i could free-hand engrave some small jewelry pieces, but without a vice grip it was impossible -- the torque produced when putting the engraving tip to the metal sent the jewelry flying across the room. I tried to hold it in place with a hand but it didn't work out; maybe it's easier with a larger surface area to work on?
customer_reviews.author: H. Zander

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice little engraver. The little stencil that came along with it seems useless, however it works well. I purchased it to write dates etc on son's wrestling medals and it does that well. It's pretty stinking loud but most high speed things similar are.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Good unit.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easier to use than my old rotary engraver because the tip doesn't tend to "travel" caused by the spinning bit. The vibration is adjustable and works well. All I do with this is engrave keys, USB memory sticks and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Gulftest52

customer_reviews.title: Its sturdy and feels like a quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Used this to engrave aluminum and a wood sign. Its sturdy and feels like a quality tool. Changing out the tips are easy and it came with multiple tips. Definitely would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Louie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Wrote a bad review earlier because It was missing a part, but turns it it was so extremely tiny that is was loose and fell off. Good product though, I'm using it as a begginer entry into engraving.
customer_reviews.author: c.a

customer_reviews.title: engrave name on hand tools
customer_reviews.text: Bought to engrave name on hand tools i use at work. Engraved name on usa made wrenches, screw drivers, and what not. Its able to etch name into tools. Not real deep or anything but definetly noticeable. For the price, not bad.
customer_reviews.author: CJM515

customer_reviews.title: Buy a drummel tool, does the same.
customer_reviews.text: I found this item cheap, get a good drummel tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Miller

customer_reviews.title: Overall its a good engraver...loud though
customer_reviews.text: It works about as well as my small battery operated pen style engravers. Except this thing is incredibly loud. For the price, I'm overall happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kari M

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: First time attempt at glass etching and this was an easy tool. Wonderful for crafting and getting ideas out. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for crafting
customer_reviews.text: I do alot of crafts and wanted something to engrave words on my wooden plagues. It is a little noisey but I'm glad I bought it. The Tackle engraver is just what I wanted. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sls1957

customer_reviews.title: This engraver worked better than I thought haven't had much use of it ...
customer_reviews.text: This engraver worked better than I thought haven't had much use of it but when I engraved on a wrench it engraved like a pencil just have to keep a steady hand. I just used it for practices and to see what it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Check your package as soon as you get it, product may very well be damaged.
customer_reviews.text: This item was damaged. Worst part is I live outside of the USA therefore the time to return it would have passed before I could send it back. Complete rip off
customer_reviews.author: Kedron Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Works on everything
customer_reviews.text: Got it just for the fun if putting my name everywhere. And it's actually pretty useful. You gonna need to practice with it first cause it's vibrating in you hand pretty hard. But when you get the idea it's good and fun to use
customer_reviews.author: Benjo Hamo

customer_reviews.title: A nice engraving tool for crafting
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice engraving tool for crafting. Small enough for one-hand holding. The included stencils are for letter size of 7 mm by 7 mm. Measure your space of engraving before purchasing.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Was hard to use, and keep against the metal to engrave. It may be too light. Required a lot of pressure to operate cleanly.

customer_reviews.title: "Your name here". Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ plastic to files it scratches like a champ.

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Perfect for free hand engraving
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Perfect for free hand engraving. Doesn't engrave as deep as what we would like, but works great for small projects and hard to reach places.

customer_reviews.title: Write my name
customer_reviews.text: I am looking forward to using this one of these days if I don’t lose the pieces. When I do I will give a better review

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Great product , easy to us and great results. Tried on wood and metal , made nice deep marks. Will try on glass next time . For the price I am extremely happy.

customer_reviews.title: Button was broke upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we unboxed it the button was stuck on but figured as little as we use it it would be okay that way. Get it back out this year and it doesn’t even work....:/

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use

I’m going to buy some dog collar tags and do some for my animals. Definitely a cool little tool to have!

product_meta.title: TACKLIFE EGD12AC Classic Multi-functional Engraver Precision Carving Machine with 4 Replaceable Tungsten Carbide Steel Bits, Includes Letter/Number Template and Shape Template
feature_bullets: ▲【Engraving Tool for Personility and Decoration】Effectively acts as a rotary tool or engraver pen; Easily engraves on a wide variety of materials, engraving your unique wedding date on a glass tumbler or anything you want to engrave

▲【5-Position Calibrated Stroke Adjustment Dial】Allows you to regulate the engraving depth no matter what fine lines or deep grooves. Comfort and firm control to ensure precise results, 1.8m ultra long power cord for a unlimited use without restraint

▲【Replaceable Bits & 1 Letter Number & 1 Shape Stencils】Made of heavy-duty tungsten steel with the capacity to engrave hard surfaces; an extra allen key included for replacing tungsten steel bits easily and quickly; one letter/number stencil and one shape stencil enable you to be endless artistic possibility, and help you fulfill your engraving works
▲【6,000 SPM, 120V Powerful Motor】Reliable performance, the engraver lets you personalise your valuables or decorate metal, glass, and stone, ideal for ceramics, crafts, and jewellery making
▲【What You Get】1 x Tacklife EGD12AC Classic Engraver, 4 x Tungsten Steel Drill Bits, 1 x Letter/Number Stencil, 1 x Shape Stencil, 1x Allen Wrench, 1 x User Manual, Risk Free Return within 30 Days

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars301 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
